HOUSTON 4, TEXAS
DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY
29 September 1961
Dr. Samuel L. Becker
Division of Television, Radio, Film
University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam,
It appears unlikely that I will be at the NAEB Meeting
since unless I am definitely on the program there is no
particular reason that I would ordinarily attend. I
believe Roy Barthold will be there, however, if there
is anything that you might like to pass along to me
resulting from the Research Committee’s Meeting.
A lot of interesting findings are emerging from our
current Title VII Project. I will be interested in
your reactions to our final report.
As chairman of the APA-Division 2, ETV Committee, I am
still negotiating with Seth Spaulding concerning our
proposed big scale conference dealing with learning
theory and the new communication media. At the moment,
we will be watching the Michigan State University Con¬
ference this fall for any possible overlap with our
proposed conference.
Have you considered the possibility of a Title VII
Proposal channeled through the NAEB Research Committee
concerning some problem such as the “Changing Image”
of ETV nationally as a result of recent pronouncements
such as those of Newton Minnow?
At any rate, Sam, keep in touch with me, and in the
event that something unexpected happens that I have to
be in Washington at the time of the NAEB Meetings, which
is possible in terms of a proposal we’re negotiating with
NSF, I would be delighted to be at the Tuesday, October 2hth,
8:00 A.M. Committee Meeting.
Cordially yours.
RIE:v
Ridhard I. Evans
Professor of Psychology
cc: Roy E. Barthold
